messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Nuptials
messages.msgSnippet: I liked the general atmosphere, but I had no idea what an ROUS was. I had to look it up: Welcome to Rodents of Unusual Sweetness And you re the vegetarian???
messages.messageBody:
I liked the general atmosphere, but I had no idea what an ROUS was. I had to look it up:

Welcome to Rodents of Unusual Sweetness

And you're the vegetarian???


~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://liveandlearnconference.org


-----Original Message-----
From: Deb Lewis <ddzimlew@...>


***And everyone wonders why I want to marry this woman! <g>***

I get to wear a Dread Pirate Roberts mask and Kelly will have a tiara and
we'll have The Impressive Clergyman say "Mawiage is what bwings us
togethah today..." and we'll have an ROUS for a wing bearer (you heard
me, wing) and the caterer will serve shrieking eels and we'll honeymoon
in the Fire Swamp....

You've made me so happy. <sniff>

Deb

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Nuptials was Re:  is there anyone like me?
messages.msgSnippet: My partner and I are not married (well, not really--only in the eyes of the state ), but we talk about it sometimes. I always say, whatever vows we come
messages.messageBody:
My partner and I are not married (well, not really--only in the eyes of
the state <smile>), but we talk about it sometimes. I always say,
whatever vows we come up with have to include him hissing, "Skip to the
end! Skip to the end!" I would love to really do it.

I used to have such severe environmental sensitivities that I would
sometimes wear a mask at big group gatherings like conferences, to
protect myself from perfume and scented grooming products. When I got
tired of explaining why I was wearing it, if someone asked I would say,
"It's just that they're so terribly comfortable. I think everyone will
be wearing them in the future." If the person got the joke, I knew i
had a new friend.

The Princess Bride--is there anything it can't do?

Su

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Nuptials was Re:  is there anyone like me?
messages.msgSnippet: We just watched Princess Bride on a really big screen yesterday.  Our Homeschool group put on a production of Midsummer Night s Dream. The cast was composed of
messages.messageBody:
We just watched Princess Bride on a really big screen yesterday. Our
Homeschool group put on a production of Midsummer Night's Dream. The cast
was composed of over 40 kids ages 5-17...in between shows we needed
something to keep everyone somewhat calm and contained and entertained. The
church we did the show in has a big screen with a set-up for movies. What
was really funny was over half of the kids were reciting the movie word for
word during the whole thing. Great fun!!



~April
Mom to Kate-19, Lisa-16, Karl-14, & Ben-10.
*REACH Homeschool Grp, an inclusive group in Oakland County
<http://www.reachhomeschool.com> www.reachhomeschool.com

* Michigan Unschoolers
<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/>
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/

success."
Albert Einstein (1879-1955)

***And everyone wonders why I want to marry this woman! <g>***

I get to wear a Dread Pirate Roberts mask and Kelly will have a tiara and
we'll have The Impressive Clergyman say "Mawiage is what bwings us
togethah today..." and we'll have an ROUS for a wing bearer (you heard
me, wing) and the caterer will serve shrieking eels and we'll honeymoon
in the Fire Swamp....

You've made me so happy. <sniff>

Deb
